thread.title: Green Line’s D branch temporarily down to remove hanging tree - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Green Line’s D branch temporarily down to remove hanging tree - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Green Line’s D branch temporarily down to remove hanging tree - Massachusetts news
text:
Starting at 11 a.m., the MBTA shut down the Green Line’s D branch between Fenway and Reservoir in both directions as officials remove a tree leaning above overhead wires at Reservoir.
“The overhead wires carry 600 volts of electricity (for powering trolleys),” MBTA spokesperson Joe Pesaturo said in an email. “We can’t wait for the tree to fall before taking action.”
The suspension of service is expected to last two hours. The MBTA suggested riders take the C line instead while the crews work.
 Gallery: These are the busiest MBTA stops
